layout.name: targetNPCID
layout.title: Target NPC Type
layout.tooltip: If set, the camera will lock onto this kind of NPC, in addition to the player.

layout.name: zoom
layout.title: Zoom
layout.tooltip: The zoom to use inside of the controller. 0 represents no change, 1 is normal zoom.

layout.name: rotation
layout.title: Rotation
layout.tooltip: The rotation to use inside of the controller (in degrees, clockwise).

layout.name: offsetX
layout.title: X Offset
layout.tooltip: The distance the camera will be horizontally offset from its targets.

layout.name: offsetY
layout.title: Y Offset
layout.tooltip: The distance the camera will be vertically offset from its targets.

layout.name: screenWidth
layout.title: Screen Width
layout.tooltip: The width of the screen itself while in the controller. 0 will keep it at its default size.

layout.name: screenHeight
layout.title: Screen Height
layout.tooltip: The height of the screen itself while in the controller. 0 will keep it at its default size.

layout.name: screenOffsetX
layout.title: Screen X Offset
layout.tooltip: The distance the screen itself will be horizontally offset from its usual position.

layout.name: screenOffsetY
layout.title: Screen Y Offset
layout.tooltip: The distance the screen itself will be vertically offset from its usual position.

layout.name: boundOnLeft
layout.title: Boundary on Left
layout.tooltip: If checked, the left side of the controller will act as a boundary for the camera.

layout.name: boundOnRight
layout.title: Boundary on Right
layout.tooltip: If checked, the right side of the controller will act as a boundary for the camera.

layout.name: boundOnTop
layout.title: Boundary on Top
layout.tooltip: If checked, the top side of the controller will act as a boundary for the camera.

layout.name: boundOnBottom
layout.title: Boundary on Bottom
layout.tooltip: If checked, the bottom side of the controller will act as a boundary for the camera.

layout.name: treatCameraBoundsAsPhysical
layout.title:
Treat Camera Bounds
As Physical
layout.tooltip: If checked, the player will treat the boundaries for the camera as physical walls/death barriers while inside the controller.

layout.name: priority
layout.title: Priority
layout.tooltip: A priority value that affects how it interacts with other camera controllers.

layout.text:
Notes
Zooming out: Unlike handycam, zooming outwards is supported. Do note, however, that it may be a bit buggy, especially for NPC's with custom rendering. Does not support darkness or foreground parallax layers.
